summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from August 2019 summarizing investigative activity related to the death of Jeffrey Epstein. It details interviews with Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) inmates and guards, attempts to serve subpoenas, and the execution of search warrants for guard phone records. The document reveals the FBI's immediate investigation into potential evidence destruction and guard conduct following Epstein's death.

persons.name: UC Skiles
persons.context: Appears as a recipient (likely an FBI agent or supervisor) of an email summarizing investigative activity regarding the Epstein death investigation.

persons.name: SSA
persons.context: Signs off the investigative summary email as the Supervisory Special Agent for the Indian Country and Violent Crime Unit, Criminal Investigative Division.

events.title: FBI interviews MCC inmate about document shredding
events.description: FBINY/NYOIG interviewed an MCC inmate regarding possible shredding of Epstein documents. The inmate stated he had no information or knowledge of any suspicious acts or MCC employees shredding documents.

events.title: FBI interviews BOP MCC guards
events.description: FBINY/NYOIG conducted multiple interviews with Bureau of Prisons (BOP) guards from the MCC. One guard refused to answer questions and requested an attorney. Another guard, who worked the 8x4 shift in the Special Housing Unit (SHU), was not working when Epstein was found and no irregularities were found in his interview. A guard with the rank of Lieutenant (LT) was also interviewed and had nothing significant to add.

events.title: Attempt to serve Grand Jury Subpoena on BOP MCC guard
events.description: NYOIG planned to attempt to serve a Federal Grand Jury Subpoena on a BOP MCC guard.

events.title: Search warrants served on Sprint and Verizon
events.description: FBINY served search warrants on cellular phone companies Sprint and Verizon for the phones belonging to two MCC Correctional Officers (COs) to obtain Call Detail Records (CDRs) and subscriber information.

events.title: Planned retrieval of cellular phone from BOP MCC Guard
events.description: An email from August 22, 2019, notes the possibility of retrieving a cellular phone from a BOP MCC Guard the following day.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively investigating the possibility that MCC employees shredded documents related to Jeffrey Epstein following his death.
Multiple BOP MCC guards were interviewed; at least one refused to answer questions and requested an attorney, indicating potential legal concerns or non-cooperation.
The FBI served search warrants on Sprint and Verizon to obtain phone records for specific MCC Correctional Officers, suggesting an investigation into their communications.
The investigation was ongoing as of August 22, 2019, with plans to retrieve a guard's cell phone and await the Medical Examiner's (ME/OCME) report and financials on guards.

The document shows a coordinated investigative effort between FBI New York (FBINY), the NY Office of the Inspector General (NYOIG), and the Criminal Investigative Division (CID) immediately after Epstein's death.
